actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.
Reported to House from the Committee on Agriculture with amendment, H. Rept. 96-213.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure laid on table in House, S. 984 passed in lieu.

official_title: A bill to provide the Secretary of Agriculture with flexibility in the imposition of marketing penalties for peanuts.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Agriculture with amendment, H. Rept. 96-213) Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 to authorize a reduction in the amount of any penalty imposed for a particular violation of a marketing quota for peanuts, if such violation was unintentional or unknowing, and a reduction of such penalty would not impair the effective operation of the peanut price support program, effective for the 1978 through 1981 crops of peanuts.

titles.title: A bill to provide the Secretary of Agriculture with flexibility in the imposition of marketing penalties for peanuts.
